means: 犁过而未播种的，休闲的，（指耕地）未经耕作的
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 法洛绰号，黄头发者，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“黄色，黄褐色”(yellow,tawny)

sentence.Network_en: Farmers are now paid to let their land lie fallow .
sentence.Network_cn: 农民让土地休耕现在得到了回报。

sentence.Network_en: Leaving some fields fallow provided a natural check on insect populations.
sentence.Network_cn: 让一些土地休耕是自然控制昆虫数量的办法.

sentence.Network_en: Summer fallow is the best method of destroying weeds.
sentence.Network_cn: 夏季休耕是消灭杂草的最好办法.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English fealgian 'to break up land for sowing', of Germanic origin; related to Low German falgen
Old English falu, fealu, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vaal and German fahl, falb

entry.tran: (土地)犁过而未耕种的;(尤指)休耕的
entry.def: Fallow land has been dug or ploughed but nothing has been planted in it, especially so that its quality or strength has a chance to improve.

example.ex: ...great red barns in empty fallow fields...
example.tran: 在空荡荡的休耕田地上的巨大红色谷仓

entry.tran: (某段时期)无甚成就的，无作为的
entry.def: A fallow period is a time when very little is being achieved.

example.ex: There followed something of a fallow period professionally, until a job came up in the summer.
example.tran: 接着在事业上无甚起色，直到夏季有了一份工作。

means.word_mean: 1. cultivated land that is not seeded for one or more growing seasons
1. left unplowed and unseeded during a growing season;
